context.aboutme: Hello world! I'm Daniel, a computer science, chemistry, and business student at the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor. I'm passionate about combining ideas from different fields to further society. Find out more about me below!

education.title: University of Michigan
education.subtitle: College of Literature, Science, and the Arts
education.degree: B.S.Chem in Computer Science and Chemistry

featuredProjects.title: linktracker
featuredProjects.subtitle: Virtual Meeting Link Organizer
featuredProjects.description: During the pandemic, the only way to meet up with coworkers or friends was through virtual conferencing tools. However, it can be tough to keep track of all the links used to join different meetings. linktracker helps you keep track of meeting links in the browser, remembering when meetings take place and their associated links.

featuredProjects.title: chatroom
featuredProjects.subtitle: Live Chat Application
featuredProjects.description: Websockets provide a significant functionality upgrade to websites, allowing live updates between the client and the server to take place. Using socket.io, I created a simple chat application, allowing users to create new chat rooms and send messages in each room. The application runs on Express.js, Node.js, and Socket.io.

featuredProjects.title: LC2K01
featuredProjects.subtitle: Assembly Simulator
featuredProjects.description: Learning assembly is a rite of passage for programmers. Suddenly, there is no compiler managing types or memory for you. You're in control of everything, but with great power comes great responsibility, and great confusion. I created a simulator for people learning assembly to test out the LEGv8 instruction set architecture, a subset of ARMv8 that is often used in educational settings.

researchExperience.title: Student Researcher

researchExperience.description: I will be working with Prof. Ensafi on internet censorship measurement and monitoring.

researchExperience.title: Student Researcher
researchExperience.location: University of Michigan Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
researchExperience.description: Working under Profs. Mudge and Dreslinski, I have been developing software and hardware techniques to optimize subgraph matching on temporal graphs.

researchExperience.title: Student Researcher
researchExperience.location: University of Michigan Department of Chemistry
researchExperience.description: Currently, I am working with Prof. Melanie Sanford at the University of Michigan, using a combined experimental and computational approach to expand the scope of C-H activation methodology. For this research, I received the 2022 Goldwater Scholarship and a fellowship through the Margaret & Herman Sokol Award in 2020.
